queries.js Script¶

freshQuery(queryDict)¶

Used to reload the current page, removing the current query string if applicable and adding a new query string from the queryDict argument

Arguments:
  • queryDict (Object) – an object with each required query string key as a property with the required value as its value; i.e such that queryDict[key] = value for each key-value pair required in the query
updateQuery(queryDict)¶

Used to reload the current page, updating the query string from the queryDict argument Queries already present will have their values overwritten if specified in the queryDict argument; requested queries not previously present will be appended to the query string

Arguments:
  • queryDict (Object) – an object with each required query string key as a property with the required value as its value; i.e such that queryDict[key] = value for each key-value pair required in the query
ensureQuery(queryDict)¶

Used to ensure that a query string exists for the current page - if one does not, redirects to the current page but with a query string built from the key-value pairs of the ‘queryDict’ argument

Arguments:
  • queryDict (Object) – an object with each required query string key as a property with the required value as its value; i.e such that queryDict[key] = value for each key-value pair required in the query
ensureKeyQuery(key, defaultValue)¶

Used to ensure that a query exists for a specific key on the current page - if it does not, redirects to the current page but with the key in the query string with value set to the specified default value

Arguments:
  • key (string) – the key to check for in the query string and add if missing
  • defaultValue (string) – the value to set the key to if it is not present
